website_summaries.verdict: One of the most affordable, quality ASUS motherboards available for low end PC builds.
pros: Motherboard architecture offers basic power and temperature management
Anti-surge feature will protect the motherboard from damage during an unexpected power outage
cons: Port placement may make it difficult to connect various parts of the PC up with internal cable management

customer_reviews.title: Does not have core unlock.  Read description of model on ASUS web site
customer_reviews.text: buyer beware. The description on Amazon for this board is incorrect when I comes to the core unlock feature. I based my purchase on that and Usb 3 capabilities. No where on the box does it mention core unlock and after installation nowhere in the bios does it allow it. After researching it seems that its predecessor the Non-Plus board had these features. Other than that it is a decent priced board for a last gen CPU. So I'm not knocking stars for the product as it works as advertised. I'd knock stars off Amazon for false description of the board. Added picture of the proper pin placement.
customer_reviews.author: J Storey

customer_reviews.title: Radeon 3000 is no longer supported by AMD, Missing Sata6
customer_reviews.text: I, like most of you repurposed an FX8350 into a server. I didn't want to spend much money. The board is meh. If you just want to run a few low intensity services it's probably fine. However, linux radeon drivers (Important for doing anything with gnome or other linux X desktops, or virtual box) have not be supported for a long time. So you need an inexpensive nvidia card. Ok, well that takes up your only PCIe slot, so you have to choose if you want video or RAID support. Sata3.... should have been sata6. Keep those things in mind when you're shopping.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Cochran

customer_reviews.title: every went together exactly as needed and the motherboard itself looks nice. I did have to do an online search ...
customer_reviews.text: Had no issues at all with this motherboard for my budget PC build; every went together exactly as needed and the motherboard itself looks nice. I did have to do an online search to find out how to get to the BIOS menu but other than that not a hitch.
customer_reviews.author: J. C.

customer_reviews.title: asus motherboard
customer_reviews.text: working so far, fresh motherboard is always uplifting, user friendly , price needs to be decreased i think maybe by 15.00,glad it was there for my cpu, reliability needs more time to realize , software has that cheesy look, bios is simple to use, no sata 6/gb only 3, hdmi port on back, so its a plane jane, with 15.00 more on price tag. im up and running, on my scale i would say 7.5 out of 10.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for Budget Builds
customer_reviews.text: It's a great board for the price. I'm only docking a star because you'll probably encounter some issues if you try to use one of the FX series processors at high load. I'm running this with an FX-8150 and the motherboard actually isn't capable of supply so much power to the chip (though to be fair, the FX chips consume an absurd amount of energy). Otherwise it's a great value for the stuff you get.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Kato

customer_reviews.title: Game Saver
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this board as an emergency replacement. The original board from a different brand would not work correctly. This one worked fine out the box. Also at the time of this review rather inexpensive. The color scheme is great if you are going for style and looks. The board just feels better designed overall. I have only had it a day, but already proved its worth.
customer_reviews.author: montykupo

customer_reviews.title: Great MB for a Windows 7 machine
customer_reviews.text: Great MB for a Windows 7 machine. Not so great for Windows 10. Windows 10 Pro seems to have alot of generic drivers for this mainboard and it is kinda buggy. Took quite awhile to get all the kinks out of an install. ASUS doesn't provide any support for windows 10 for this board.
customer_reviews.author: Ree TECH

customer_reviews.title: High frequency noise
customer_reviews.text: High frequency noise come from speaker. If you had cheap speaker you may not notice it but i have a good audio system so I can hear it clearly. I tried HDMI, video card and audio but any of them did not prevent from making noise. It did not come with interface plate. The document for panel pins is terrible and not right. I managed to figure it out but after all I can not stand the noise.
customer_reviews.author: Shoon

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT SUPPORT WINDOWS 10 !!!! BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: Please be aware that ASUS does not support windows 10 on this MB, contrary to comments i have read. Asus does not support windows 10 for this MB nor do they have drivers for windows 10. This MB becomes very unstable and crashes constantly when using windows 10 with it !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: AGENT-9

customer_reviews.title: Not a good board
customer_reviews.text: I love Asus products and I have never had an issue with one before. But this board, well you get what you pay for. The board does support windows 10, which is nice. BUT the board's "anti surge" protection is sketchy. The motherboard overvolted and fried my usb ports, including 2 of the items I had plugged into them.
customer_reviews.author: Maxfarace

customer_reviews.title: The wifes main rig.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an M5A88-M that ran 24/7 for years. Easy replacement, didn't even have to reinstall Windows. Wired it up and turned it on, found all the drivers in Windows Update and it's been non-stop running folding@home at 100% throttle for the last 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Support Windows 10 Pro 64bit
customer_reviews.text: As shown in the pictures, mother board does not support Windows 10. Even on their website where you get the drivers from if you don't have the DVD does not have windows 10. Past that, the motherboard works just fine, uses older style BIOS. Someone else posted a pic of the pin outs that they did not put into the manual.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: A major upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Used this and a bargain 6-core AMD chip to build a relatively fast PC. Be sure you've got at least 650W power supply. The combination won't work with only 550W. Once I got the power solved this board and chip combo have been pretty fast and runs everything, with USB 3 and expansion slots. 4 RAM slots, so if you have a 64-bit OS can run lots of ram. I'm pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Motley

customer_reviews.title: Ordered wrong product.
customer_reviews.text: I searched "LGA 1150 motherboard" on amazon and bought this. This is for AMD. Can't knock it on anything as I never tried it. Maybe worth noting, the box was not sealed nor was the static bag, but it appeared to be new. Writing this for others who are searching for an LGA 1150 mobo, 5 star review so it doesn't hurt the product rating.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Good affordable motherboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this motherboard due to the crazy prices for am3+ boards. This was the most affordable board that had enough ram slots on it and USB 3.0. I have had this board in my computer for 8 months and have had no problems. It works with windows 10 and I overclocked my fx-6300 to 4.4ghz (hyper 212 evo cooler)The only con about this board is the bios, which seems ancient. But other than that it is affordable and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Good price good board just as described
customer_reviews.text: Nice board for the money easy to install no issues only negative is the instruction make you do a QR in order to get the pin configuration which was a little clumsy. Also be aware that it has no Windows 10 drivers it will work in Windows 10 with limitations on the graphics card the how high you can go on your desktop settings. Windows 10 already has the AMD drivers so there is no need to download any additional drivers. This is a great board for an average computer user that does not do heavy gaming.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sadly the motherboard shipped to me was defective, so the problems I was having were related to that.
customer_reviews.author: eggehad

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have an AMD FX 8350 installed with 16GB of ram, and a GTX 590. All works as expected. The motherboard maintains a nice cool temperature. It would be nice to have just one more fan header instead of all those sata connectors.
customer_reviews.author: Leonartist

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do RAID5 but other than that excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great for what I intended - a perhaps somewhat over-she'd home server with a 4 GHz AMD CPU, 8 gigs of RAM and a 120 gig SSD for software. It supports RAID0, 1, 10 and JBOD but crucially for me NOT RAID 5, so I have to splash out another 70 bucks for another ensemble of spinning rust
customer_reviews.author: Darren H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, got the job done
customer_reviews.text: Looks really cool, does exactly what it's designed to do. I was replacing an old Pegatron board with an AMD Phenom quad core, and this guy is awesome for that- quick, easy installation process, and the drivers were a jog in the park compared to other stuff I've tried installing. Don't forget to take the $10 rebate from ASUS as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dave W

customer_reviews.title: Includes DVI, VGA, and HDMI and USB3 ports
customer_reviews.text: Nice board worked flawlessly. Easy to set up and put into service. Used it to repair another MB that died. The on-board features are a real value saving one from purchasing and installing a separate card.
customer_reviews.author: FIllC

customer_reviews.title: Limited fan headers, no uefi bios
customer_reviews.text: I was just disappointed that this mb didn't have uefi bios, it also doesn't have enough fan headers for my case so I'm going to have to purchase an adapter. I thought the board looked cool but it really isn't anything special.
customer_reviews.author: sinister

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, Solid Board
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great mobo especially for the price. Fairly easy to install, I had to bend back the IO shield tabs a bit but then it fit perfectly into the shield and case. No complaints, board runs my AMD FX-6300 just fine and the GPU. It runs Windows 10 just fine. Will update if anything changes. Go ASUS!
customer_reviews.author: Will W

customer_reviews.title: ... condemn all of these boards but I had a bad experience with the one I purchased
customer_reviews.text: I won't condemn all of these boards but I had a bad experience with the one I purchased. I used it for less than 2 weeks and the pc would just shut off on it's own with an amd northbridge error in the event logs. Happened about 5 times in that time period. Couldn't do a direct exchange for another one to see if I'd get lucky and get a working board so opted for a refund instead.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Useable, but rather low-end
customer_reviews.text: A workable AM3+ motherboard, but certainly very low-end by ASUS's standards. No UEFI support (may or may not be a good thing for you). Current BIOS apparently wants to program the timings for older AMD processors a bit too aggressively. Does include support for ECC memory like all of ASUS's offerings. While memory errors don't happen too often, they're certainly common enough to bother protecting your data.
customer_reviews.author: EHeM

customer_reviews.title: Good MOBO, but no Windows 10 Drivers for onboard features.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good motherboard, however it is from approx 2016, and ASUS doesn't have Windows 10 drivers for it. I know, because I contacted them. It runs OK, but I am unable to adjust the embedded video card because ASus doesn't have the drivers.
customer_reviews.author: spider

customer_reviews.title: Decent motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my old Gigabyte motherboard as a web and file server because the Gigabyte one didn't have wake on lan. I didn't want the computer running all day. Wake on lan works good sometimes but at least it works. I haven't tried this for anything else like gaming or movies.
customer_reviews.author: SomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: Used with a FX6300
customer_reviews.text: Needed to put some spare parts I had to use in a system so I got this board and FX6300. All went together and didn't break the bank. Definitely worthy for a budget system.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kai

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard.
customer_reviews.text: Great motherboard.. i have had 4 asus. and they perform great. ASUS M5A78L-M Plus/USB3 DDR3 HDMI DVI USB 3.0 setup in ROSEWILL Micro ATX Mini Tower Computer Case, Black Steel and plastic computer case with 1x 120mm front fan and 1x 80mm rear fan, Front I/O and 2x USB 3.0 with transparent side panel
customer_reviews.author: Jude Eristhee

customer_reviews.title: Good product, no fan headers other than cpu
customer_reviews.text: Looks amazing and arrived quickly, Has worked for everything I need and I'm currently running an fx 4300 and a GTX 1050 TI as my budget PC build, has nice heatsinks and the only issue I ran into was that there wasnt any fan headers if you're looking for a lot of fans, however my card covers me there. Good product would recommend
customer_reviews.author: logan

customer_reviews.title: Dead On Arrival
customer_reviews.text: MOBO was DOA. Tested with 2 different CPU's, PSU's and different sticks of RAM. Still refused to even give so much as a beep or display anything on a monitor. Can't return it because I live outside of the US and it'd cost as much as the board did to send it back. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Shiva Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Factory packaging,  fast shipping,  easy install
customer_reviews.text: First board is my old m4a78lt-m, i replaced it with this M5A78L-M plus/usb 3.0 board. It got here 6 days before the tracking stated it would which was wonderful. Factory packaging, install was a breeze just make sure you boot into bios first boot and set your settings.
customer_reviews.author: Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the previous version in a 4-year-old custom build. easy out, easy in. upgrades well done. Fine mobo,
customer_reviews.author: Old Drummerboy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Only downside is no full manual is included and no full manual available on ASUS website. Otherwise works great for my FX and Phenom II X6 processors.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: but for regular amd cpu it is good
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my AMD FX-9590 CPU 220w but not supposed the CPU up 220w it means that not work for me thanks .
customer_reviews.author: zhenda

customer_reviews.title: Motherboard works but it has USB 3.0 but no SATA 6gb/s, kind of unusual.
customer_reviews.text: Only issue I have with this board is the lack of SATA 6gb/s. Most boards I've seen with USB 3.0 also had the SATA 6gb/s but this does not. Will be using it in a spare bedroom eventually after upgrading again.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Domer

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement
customer_reviews.text: My case was a bit of an issue - not the MB's fault... great replacement for my old MB that crapped out on me...
customer_reviews.author: Nightshifter

customer_reviews.title: Really well designed motherboard
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard has everything I needed and I have did some overclocking with success on it. Instructions are good and materials used look durable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M

customer_reviews.title: Clean refurbished motherboard
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this refurbished ASUS motherboard to replace a failed Gigabyte board, as a lower cost alternative to replacing the whole system. Pros: -Motherboard was in like-new condition -Board powered up with no problems Cons: -Bent pin on audio connector (was easy to straighten) -No documentation, but easy enough to find online
customer_reviews.author: C Wiley

customer_reviews.title: amd board
customer_reviews.text: good features for price. most up to date board for old amd chips amp+3 chips
customer_reviews.author: ladykat

customer_reviews.title: Good for a short-term motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Its good for a short-term motherboard, but I won't recommend it. The biggest draw back is, it'll work up to Windows 7, not Windows 10, which is why I basically would call this a short-term board
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Integrated Graphics
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for 2 $170 Athalon II builds. So far, everything just fits right together. I havent gotten past the BIOS stage of installing an OS, so we'll see how that goes. I was happy to know that this mobo has integrated graphics. That's part of why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: graphingofphotons

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace the motherboard for my secondary computer. The gigabyte one that I had in it had a defect that made it not use all of. The RAM installed. This one worked perfectly right away, and I have had no issues at all
customer_reviews.author: JJ Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Asus is the best.
customer_reviews.text: Nice cheap motherboard I got my FX 6300 to a stable 4.1 GHz 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth romero

customer_reviews.title: We'll See...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Asus Aura gaming motherboard, died within a few months. Replaced it with this. If this doesn't work, there will be no more Asus stuff for me at all. We'll have to wait and see what this does for me in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Shaggy

customer_reviews.title: FX 6300 8Gigs Radeon HD RetroPi Ubuntu 18.04
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a FX6300 CPU which i used as my right 3 years ago, then I decided to use with RetroPie, installed Ubuntu 18.04 and installed RetroPie , worked just fine, but used a Radeon HD some number, don't recall as of the moment, and 8 gigs of memory..
customer_reviews.author: UTAN

customer_reviews.title: Fine littke board
customer_reviews.text: I feel like it's overpriced but works for my budget side system
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It lasted seven months
customer_reviews.text: The ASUS M5A78L-M Plus/USB3 DDR3 HDMI DVI USB 3.0 760G AM3+ based Motherboard worked great for seven months but then failed. Not worth the effort or the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi D

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if my FX 8350 got fried along with ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if my FX 8350 got fried along with my previous motherboard , but my FX 6300 works perfectly with this board and boosts up to 3.8ghz safely with the Hyper 212 evo attached to it.
customer_reviews.author: George B.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works like I need it to and better quality then I was excepting
customer_reviews.author: Robert Guithues

customer_reviews.title: Also terrible for overclocking
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't working at first, had to restart it a bunch and once it did work it's always freezing up and restarting. Not my memory, CPU, GPU, or PSU. Now it's not even booting to bios. Also terrible for overclocking, do not get this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole A. Olschewske

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item and I would recommend it to everyone who wants to have a decent mother board with nice speed and able to handle the load.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Geathers

customer_reviews.title: Good for low/medium end.
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a medium-end gaming rig, does everything as needed for the build.
customer_reviews.author: Cushaway

customer_reviews.title: Great performance for an AM3+ motherbpard
customer_reviews.text: I installed it and my son is enjoying the upgrade from an old HP.
customer_reviews.author: Locutis6of9

customer_reviews.title: perfect for the price. and you can beef it up amazing 32 gb max of ram. am3+  just great for a mid range grade mother board
customer_reviews.text: 32 gb max on ram, great small size.... i put a AMD Black 6300 6 core 3.4 processor in it.. im running 12 gb of ram atm with a 660 GTX Nvidia 2gb gpu and i tell ya this thing runs ANYTHING... love this mother board along with the Thermaltake Versa H15 SPCC Micro atx i bought at the same time....
customer_reviews.author: Todd Carter

customer_reviews.title: I recommend a Ryson Socket mother board
customer_reviews.text: Although This motherboard can handle gaming But don’t expect too much from this motherboard
customer_reviews.author: Roxas

customer_reviews.title: upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I had an older Dell that died. I was able to swap boards and use everything from the original Dell. The VGA port has a flaky connection and rocks on the mother board. Since I was already using a video card after setup it did not matter. My only hindsight was not ordering a fast CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: New computer runs great
customer_reviews.text: just built a new ddr3 based computer for my first build and this was exactly what I needed. for the money its deffinetly a solid choice. no overclock support though :/
customer_reviews.author: Daniel K Morrell

customer_reviews.title: Good board if not using Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: I bought this board last year and installed Windows 10 and been getting errors after errors and bsod if you are using Windows 8 older you will be fine and as of now there is no windows 10 driver support from ASUS
customer_reviews.author: Sudarshini

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Love this board. Might need to order a couple extra. support 32gb ram and was able to use some Dell desktop ram also.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a powerful little board that even handles the AMD/8370 8 core processor with 16 gigs of memory.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Baze

customer_reviews.title: Came broken
customer_reviews.text: When shipped packaging was good but the socket to put the cpu in was broken and it wouldn't set down correctly. Threw away the box and now i'm unsure what to do with it since I spent $80 on it.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn I.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing sent to attach the motherboard.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought and built many computers in the passed. I have never received a motherboard that did not come with the things needed install them in a case.
customer_reviews.author: Lascelle & Amber Brown

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: This unit worked well with my Phenom II CPU and is one of my fastest computers. Overall performance is what I had hoped for.
customer_reviews.author: Pat E

customer_reviews.title: Not the best but it works
customer_reviews.text: Not the best motherboard. I knew that going into it. But did not have any problems with it either. So it does its job for my customer.
customer_reviews.author: PC Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good Motherboard Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation to replace a motherboard that was giving problems. Acting exactly as I expected to keep a several year old computer functional.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2Michael

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Value!
customer_reviews.text: Great motherboard for processors using the AM3+ socket. Supports four (4) DDR3 memory modules, up to 32 GB total, integrated ATI Radeon graphics plus pci-e expansion capacity for add-on graphics cards. Comes w/manual and driver disc.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Good product for home use.
customer_reviews.text: Good product with USB3.0. Works well with AMD FX8350. Great for home use. However the previously purchased one developed a hardware fault after some months, resulting in no audio on the 3.5mm socket; quite unexpected.
customer_reviews.author: yipjcs88

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely, no complaints
customer_reviews.text: Works nicely, no hiccups, windows 7/10 auto installs all the drivers, easy stuff. Installed a fx6300 and 8 gigs of gskill
customer_reviews.author: PeteyPabloYo

customer_reviews.title: This motherboard is perfect for my pc build
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard is perfect for my pc build. If you are only looking for an everyday pc build, it has onboard graphics. If not, you can always add a graphics card for a powerful gpu. I would recommend it to anyone with a small computer case or to someone trying to play it safe.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan N.

customer_reviews.title: Nice motherboard with a ton of features at a great ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice motherboard with a ton of features at a great price. I wish it had SATA III, but at this price you can't go wrong with the AMD3 line of processors.
customer_reviews.author: alex voss

customer_reviews.title: Great board, small
customer_reviews.text: Great board, small, powerful and reliable, unlike the Gigabyte I am replacing that took a big steamy dump one day, shorted out and make sparks spit out of my video card GPU, but I digress, this ASUS board is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Tornado Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed to upgrade my PC. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: HD

customer_reviews.title: easy pin layout.
customer_reviews.text: it OK. Bigger then I thought, but that's my fault for not checking it's dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua DL100

customer_reviews.title: It booted perfectly and so far works great with 8GB of RAM
customer_reviews.text: I salvaged an AMD2 processor from an old pc. I purchased this mobo and put it in. It booted perfectly and so far works great with 8GB of RAM.
customer_reviews.author: Ticobuyer

customer_reviews.title: Trust in the Lord always
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this motherboard and uninstalling it it didn't even beep post beep or nothing, Amazon doesn't know what they're doing when it comes to selling electronic products. Come here for a minute
customer_reviews.author: Casimiro DiSalvo Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't feel like spending $$ to build new system
customer_reviews.text: No problem so far. Brought it to replace a dead old board. Didn't feel like spending $$ to build new system. My computer still plenty fast for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper5566

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Seller got it to me quicker than expected. Cons: Won't boot past initial Windows start screen, if it gets that far.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Montalvo

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my first build with an AMD FX-6300 6 core. Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: JMack

customer_reviews.title: Missing accessory
customer_reviews.text: I received the item well packaged an like new. Only issue is it didn’t come with the correct accessory. Motherboard faceplate doesn’t match up they gave me the wrong one it doesn’t fit the motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Returned-Still waiting for replacement
customer_reviews.text: The RAM IC burned up within a week so I requested a return with an exact replacement. Been two weeks and Amazon has yet to replace the board. Meanwhile, we sit with a MOBO-less case.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: I've been using this board in my gaming rig for ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this board in my gaming rig for over a year now. And boy, I'm loving it.
customer_reviews.author: An Honest Review

customer_reviews.title: Don't go this cheap route. Spend a little more
customer_reviews.text: Motherboard did its job for the first couple months but now I'm having a lot of issues when it comes to gaming. If you're a gamer, pay a little more and get a better ASUS mobo with newer DDR slots
customer_reviews.author: Skylar

customer_reviews.title: Delivery Service was horrible I was told "expect delivery through UPS
customer_reviews.text: Delivery Service was horrible I was told "expect delivery through UPS, instead I got it through USPS" It took a long while however this product is awesome. Totally a brand new pc. Fast an efficient till now I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son for his PC build. He is pleased with it. Was able to put together a good gamer PC at a reasonable budget.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy T.

customer_reviews.title: The I/O shield is a bit flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: Windows 10 does work, it would just be nice if Asus provided updated drivers themselves since they exist for the chipset. Just make sure to use windows update and check device Manager manually.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: very nice mobo
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Small footprint. I use this as a media/cctv server. So running 24/7
customer_reviews.author: the bubba

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard. Fast and very easy to built
customer_reviews.text: Flawless. Great motherboard. Fast and very easy to built. ASUS makes excellent products.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia T.

customer_reviews.title: Overheats vrm throtting Google it
customer_reviews.text: Not for gaming in 2019 without a beefy CPU cooler
customer_reviews.author: Keifer Hauck

customer_reviews.title: Easy to work with. Easy build.
customer_reviews.text: Got the job done. You can't go wrong with ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: No_square_trade

customer_reviews.title: Great board for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great board for the money, does what it needs to do at a budget, and fits nicely into any micro case I have tried so far. Blue heat sinks are a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Martin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great budget motherboard for a low budget but high end gaming PC
customer_reviews.author: Robert Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Easy build
customer_reviews.text: Installed and worked perfectly as always with ASUS motherboards, I have never had a problem building computers with ASUS motherboards
customer_reviews.author: don

customer_reviews.title: Not the best ASUS product
customer_reviews.text: Ok for my son's older system. Not the best ASUS product, but good enough for what we need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Stools

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, easy to use, great for first builds!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, easy and fits AMD processors beautifully. Basically dropped the thing and still worked!
customer_reviews.author: Braden

customer_reviews.title: He is happy. I don't know enough about computers to comment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my thirteen year-old. He is happy. I don't know enough about computers to comment.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Good, cheap board.
customer_reviews.text: the backplate doesnt line up with the pack panel ports. It takes some fiddeling to make it fit.
customer_reviews.author: Prosumer

customer_reviews.title: am2+ and am3 dose not work on am3+ cpu socket
customer_reviews.text: perfect motherboard but one thing is to make you get an am3+ CPU​ not an am2+ or am3 for me it made my pc goes black
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: Very basic motherboard but gets the job done, dose not support M.2 however
customer_reviews.author: robert butterworth

customer_reviews.title: Great price and awesome results!
customer_reviews.text: One of the most reliable and stable motherboard I use and I have built easily 20+ systems using this motherboard. Great value and great results for a beefy office workstation.
customer_reviews.author: Kay D

product_meta.title: ASUS M5A78L-M Plus/USB3 DDR3 HDMI DVI USB 3.0 760G AM3+ based Motherboard,Black
product_meta.description: Outfitted with USB 3 ports and superior audio features, the M5A78L-M Plus/USB3 microATX motherboard elevates the AMD 760G platform to new heights and is perfect for large-scale deployments. ASUS' durable quality ensures reliable and long-term performance.
feature_bullets: Core Unlocker Unlock true Core performance intelligently
Anti Surge Full time Power Guardian Make System Free From Risk
ASUS EPU System Level Energy Saving
Low EMI protect you: 50% less radiation
